meanings.definition: To slip or slide over or past something.
meanings.sent1: The cat overslipped the puddle on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: She overslipped the banana peel and almost fell.
meanings.sent3: The toy car overslipped the finish line and kept rolling.
meanings.sent4: Time overslipped through his fingers like sand.
meanings.sent5: The dancer overslipped gracefully across the stage.

meanings.definition: To pass or go beyond a limit or boundary.
meanings.sent1: The athlete overslipped his previous record in the race.
meanings.sent2: The student overslipped the word limit in the essay.
meanings.sent3: The balloon overslipped the height restriction and flew away.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement overslipped into uncontrollable laughter.
meanings.sent5: The river overslipped its banks during the heavy rain.
